intro: Clerodendrum leveillei, commonly known as the African flame bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates. Clerodendrum leveillei is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
